DOC.brief_title: Influence of Didgeridoo Practice on UA Obstruction Levels in Moderate OSA
DOC.detailed_description: Didgeridoo practice has been shown to improve Obstructive Sleep Apnea (OSA) severity. The aim of our study is to assess the changes in upper airways obstruction levels, evaluated by sleep endoscopy, before and after 3 months of Didgeridoo practice in moderate non obese OSA patients. Severity of OSA will also be documented by polysomnography.
DOC.criteria: moderate OSA, non obese not willing play didgeridoo age<18 significant lung, cardiac disease neuromuscular disease psychiatric disorders drugs with influence on respiratory drive
